com.anand.sudoku.solver.algorithm

Class SudokuBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.anand.sudoku.solver.algorithm.SudokuBoard

  • public class SudokuBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class represents a Sudoku Puzzle Board.
    Author:
    A Anand

    • Constructor Detail

      • SudokuBoard

        public SudokuBoard(java.lang.String sudokuData,
                   int row,
                   int innerRow,
                   int innerColumn)
        Constructor to initailize the SudokuBoard.
        Parameters:
        sudokuData - the concatenated string of data corresponding to the puzzle. The value for each cell should be separated by a single space
        row - the size / total no of rows or columns in the puzzle
        innerRow - the row size of a single inner box
        innerColumn - the column size of a single inner box

    • Method Detail

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        This method checks whether the sudoku board is completely solved or not. The board is solved values in all cells are not 0. If there exists a cell with 0 value in it, means the board is not solved completely.
        Returns:
        true if the board is completely solved, otherwise returns false

      • isNotFilled

        public boolean isNotFilled(int row,
                           int column)
        This method checks whether a cell is filled or not. A cell is filled if the value in the cell is not 0.
        Parameters:
        row - the row corresponding to the target cell
        column - the column corresponding to the target cell
        Returns:
        the method returns true if the cell is not filled, otherwise returns false

      • possibleEntries

        public int[] possibleEntries(int row,
                             int column)
        The method returns an array of all the possible numbers that can be placed in a particular cell pointed by the row and column. First the row of the cell, then the column of the cell and finally the inner box containing the cell is considered to determine the possible values that can be placed in the cell.
        Parameters:
        row - the row corresponding to the target cell
        column - the column corresponding to the target cell
        Returns:
        an array of values that can be placed in the target cell

      • set

        public void set(int row,
                int column,
                int value)
        This method sets the data of a particular cell to the specified value.
        Parameters:
        row - the row corresponding to the target cell
        column - the column corresponding to the target cell
        value - the value to be set in the cell pointed by the row and column values

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        This method formats and displays the sudoku board
